frameDefinitions: Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer adding some Phenomenon to their model of the world.
An Agent makes use of a Means (either an action or a (system of) entities standing in for the action) in order to achieve a Purpose.
A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning.
This frame concerns a Cognizer (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the Ground, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics.

A Researcher (an individual a group or institution) attempts to answer a Question by means of consulting literature,  observation, or conducting experiments in a particular Field pertinent to the Question.
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) negotiate an agreement.
frameExamples: Later that night, they <t>found</t> the barely-alive victim inside the Red Hall estate flat.
The primary <t>means</t> of gas detection is mass spectroscopy .
Based on the most recent census I have <t>concluded</t> that most Americans sleep too much.
We <t>searched</t> the yard  for my contact lens.
Simmons and Nadel did <t>research</t> pertaining to Ardea purpurea and Egretta garzetta in 1998
So far , we have <t>agreed</t>to cede 100km of coastline to Kiribati . DNI
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Cognizer</fen> is the person who becomes aware of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. It is normally expressed as an External Argument.
Thm <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is the entity or situation in the world of which a <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware. It is normally expressed as an Object:
This role identifes the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
<fen>Topic</fen> indicates the general field within which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is found.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> uses an <fen>Instrument</fen> to (enable themselves to) become aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.  In some cases, the <fen>Instrument</fen> may appear in subject position.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes aware of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The Agent uses the Means to acheive a Purpose.
The action performed by the Agent.
The goal or purpose of the Agent.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> uses the <fen>Means</fen>.
Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by <ment>from</ment> which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:

Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They <t>found out</t> <fex name='Topic'>about us</fex>! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:
An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which enables them to figure something out.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the text created by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to communicate that they came to believe a specified <fen>Content</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> discovers the <fen>Content</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the <fen>Content</fen>.
The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:

The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This role can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement.

The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The role is normally expressed as an External Argument:
An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>  that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is scrutinizing the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The people engaged in a research endeavor.
A significant unanswered open proposition which the <fen>Researcher</fen> is attempting to resolve.
A phenomenon or idea involved in a <fen>Question</fen>.
The time when  the research is carried out.
The physical place where the research is carried out.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e.
agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is,
<fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and
peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself
generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.

The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or
group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded
within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment made by the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in making an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Pat</fex> discovered a great little restaurant in Soho.
Pat discovered <fex>a great little restaurant</fex> in Soho.
<fex>By opening the book to page 10</fex>, you will find the Van Eerdens' number.
Scientists attempt to make discoveries <fex>about the laws of nature</fex>.
Olson says the deputy came out to the farm and detected a radioactive substance <fex>with his Geiger counter</fex>.
Robbie had wondered if they would be able to find the path <fex>at night</fex>.
<fex>Sue</fex> realized that Bob was lost.
I have learned <fex>from experience</fex> that poison oak can be painful.
The President learned <fex>that the reporters were hungry</fex>.
The jury learned something terrible <fex>about the suspect</fex>.
<fex>A post-mortem examination</fex> was unable to ascertain the cause of death.
<fex>Back at the tailor's shop</fex>, I deduced that our murderer was not the owner of the kerchief.
<fex>Leslie</fex> examined the glass for cracks.
Leslie examined <fex>the glass</fex> for cracks.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> examined the case for free speech.
The temperature controller monitored the temperature <fex>with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.
Before he became an astronaut, <fex>Grunsfeld</fex> did research in physics.
When we have researched <fex>why Brazilian mothers have stopped breastfeeding</fex>, principal reasons given are 'poor milk' and 'insufficient milk' .
Would you take part in research <fex>on the best place to have a baby</fex>?

<fex>During summer of 1999</fex>, I did research using a technique called 'Path Integral Monte
Carlo', to simulate quantum particles.
Johnson and Randall's research <fex>in Africa</fex> has proven extremely valuable.
On Monday, <fex>the airline</fex> reached a deal with the Canadian Auto Workers.
Mozilla Foundation has finally reached an agreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have agreed <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have agreed to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The town coucil members finally reached an agreement <fex>at midnight</fex>.
The town coucil members reached an agreement <fex>at the City Hall plenary session</fex>.
